Summary of evidence: Worldwide, bladder cancer is the 10th most commonly diagnosed cancer.
Several risk factors associated with BC diagnosis have been identified.

Active and passive tobacco smoking continues to be the main risk factor, while exposure-related 
incidence is decreasing.

The increased risk of developing BC in patients undergoing EBRT, brachytherapy, or a combination 
of EBRT and brachytherapy, must be considered during patient follow-up. As BC requires time to 
develop, patients treated with radiation at a young age are at the greatest risk and should be followed-
up closely.
